author: potuz
content: right, but on the CL API side, should I return that string or should I return the full transaction?

author: m.kalinin
content: A transaction is a list of bytes on CL side, thus, it should be a string of bytes in the API. AFAIK, it's not yet in the API standard. `0x` prefixed HEX string looks good enough to go with.

content: Ok so I took the right approach then, that block above corresponds to Marius' block

author: ajsutton
content:
Perfect, those are working for me - I must have been looking at the wrong inventory or read it wrong.  It looks like the ee-endpoint the option is coming out as `----Xee-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8545` which has four `-` at the start instead of two.  So we're running completely in optimistic sync mode.  And since it's an unrecognised option after the `--eth1-endpoints` so is being treated as a second eth1 endpoint which is why we're not hearing anything about an invalid option but are getting strange logs saying eth1-endpoint 2 is invalid.

I haven't been able to find the docker-compose file that configures this to fix it manually, but not sure if a new ansible run is the best option anyway.

content:
Ok so the teku-nethermind node has dropped off mergenet-2.  Firstly there was a teku misconfiguration and when that was fixed it essentially tried to get nethermind to do an optimistic sync and it doesn't seem to have worked.  I've resync'd teku but Nethermind is now reporting the payload for beacon block `0xe5492fcc95c71b0a61edfd4243e83c664b7f2eaaab4b63687ee04b0725d4b41c` is invalid so Teku can't complete the sync.  That block is on the canonical chain (and I'm assuming was accepted by other nethermind instances unless they've all dropped off).
And the block explorer has gone down for me again.

author: ajsutton
content: But the good news is that teku-geth is up and running fine now it's config is fixed (optimistic sync worked).

author: ajsutton
content: oo, block explorer is back and other nethermind instances are definitely still on the chain, so it's just the teku-nethermind validator having issues.
